alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:09AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the West Branch Lackawaxen above Prompton Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 AM EDT, The stream gage on the West Branch Lackawaxen river at Aldenville was rising rapidly and minor flooding is expected to begin shortly. A crest around 7 feet is anticipated this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Branch Lackawaxen River at and downstream of Aldenville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
